newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia wins fixed access network order.
newsitem.headline: Nokia wins fixed access network order.

text.p: Finnish telecoms group Nokia Oy said on Monday it won an order for a residential access network for telephony access nodes and digital transmission and a network management system from Globe Telecom of the Philippines.
"This is the first fixed network contract Nokia has signed with Globe Telecom," Nokia said in a statement.
It did not give the value of the deal.
Globe Telecom is a telecommunications venture of holding company Ayala Corp and Singapore Telecom International.

"Nokia will also supply tropical outdoor cabinets to allow Globe Telecom to deploy the access nodes and the SDH transport system freely throughout their service areas," Nokia said, adding Globe Telecom had a mandate from the Philippine government to deploy 700,000 fixed telephone lines. --Helsinki newsroom +358-9-680 50 245, e-mail news@reuters.fi
